comments:
build i0322-1300

- I installed the new build
- I started it
- I pointed it to my previously existing workspace
- it did a full-build
- while it was building I restored the Progress view to watch
- build completed
- I minimized the Progress view
- was presented with the following error dialog (will attach)

The following errors were in my log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-03-22 15:52:03.781
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Animating rectangle".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.RectangleAnimation.run(RectangleAnimation.java:274)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-03-22 15:52:04.162
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Animating rectangle".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.RectangleAnimation.run(RectangleAnimation.java:274)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Even better... when I hit "ok" to close the error dialog, another one exactly the same pops up. I try to close that one and another one comes up. And then another. And another. Lather, rinse, repeat.

After talking to Eric this is a dup of a bug that he fixed this afternoon. It is related to the Progress View and its animation. As long as you have the Progress View restored, it will happen.

I killed Eclipse, deleted my workbench.xml file and restarted and I'm ok now. I will not restore my Progress View until tonight's build is done.

I will dup this as soon as I find the other bug.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 178743 ***
